data.description: Student Engineering Intern - Data ScienceInternDiscipline: Mechanical EngineeringCompany DescriptionBig challenges need bold thinkers.If you’re someone who sees problems as opportunities, you’ll thrive here. RESPEC is 100% employee-owned, which means we take ownership of every challenge. Here, your ideas drive real solutions. Since 1969, we’ve tackled complex challenges in energy transition, infrastructure resilience, digital transformation, and sustainability.At RESPEC, you’ll work alongside clients to take on critical problems. Depending on your expertise, you might design infrastructure in remote locations, develop renewable energy solutions for global projects, or apply data-driven technology to improve mining and water systems.We bring deep technical knowledge, real-world experience, and a commitment to work that matters. If you're looking for a place where your contributions have real impact, you’ll fit right in.Job DescriptionRESPEC seeks a Student Engineering Intern – Data Science for our Rapid City, SD office as part of our 2026 Summer Internship Program. This position is expected to work 40 hours per week during summer 2026.In this role, the intern will gain hands-on experience in data collection, analysis, and development of large-scale database systems to support engineering staff. The ideal candidate will have experience working with artificial intelligence and machine learning tools to query, analyze, and disposition large datasets, along with knowledge of database system design and implementation. Experience with GIS database systems is preferred.Additional responsibilities may include developing specialized scripts and software utilities using Python, C++, VBA, or other programming languages. The selected candidate will work under the direct supervision of experienced engineering staff.QualificationsRequired:Must be working toward a Bachelor of Science or advanced degree in computer science, computer engineering, industrial, mechanical, civil, or related fieldDemonstrated knowledge in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence tools, methods, and applicationsStrong computer skills in using standard office softwareExcellent interpersonal skills, be able to communicate effectively in writing and orally, and be self-motivatedPreferred:Familiarity with CAE software, such as 3D CAD softwareStrong working knowledge of common programming languagesAdditional InformationCompensation: Compensation depends on experience.
